alert.note: Alert for Furnas (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 28 at 7:11PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following county, Furnas. * WHEN...Until 115 AM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 710 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over the past few hours. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Sappa Creek, Dry Creek and Beaver Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of far southwestern and south central Furnas County, including along the Sappa Creek where it flows out of Norton County. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
